chargeHist.descr: Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of school (<3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dezmond C. GOSA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

RE:  Deliver heroin within 1000 feet of school, on 06-08-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of deliver heroin, deliver base cocaine, deliver heroin within 1000 feet of school and fleeing an officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 cash with the conditions that travel into Manitowoc County is only allowed for court appearances and to meet with his attorney, defendant is not to possess any controlled substances and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.  
Minutes.
